title: Will 2020 Finally Be the Year AR and VR Matter for Facebook?
text: It's been said before, but next year might actually be a breakout year for marketable applications of augmented and virtual reality technologies.

title: Payroll data for 29,000 Facebook employees reportedly stolen
text: Banking information, Social Security digits, names and salaries were stolen from several unencrypted hard drives, a report says.

title: Facebook lost some hard drives in a car break-in, but former employees probably shouldn't worry — here's why
text: Theft of unencrypted hard drives from a Facebook employee's car led the company to announce another privacy and security incident to its employees.

title: Facebook, privacy activist Schrems battle nears end on Dec. 19
text: Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems' seven-year battle against Facebook reaches a crucial point on Dec. 17 when an adviser to Europe's top court will issue his view on whether tools used by companies to transfer data abroad are legal or not.

title: FTC's Look Into Facebook A 'Negative Development,' Says RBC's Mahaney
text: The Federal Trade Commission potential move to block Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) from combining its multiple apps into one is a "negative development" for the social media company, according to RBC Capital Markets' Mark Mahaney.

title: The Feds Might Try to Block Mark Zuckerberg's Grand Plan
text: Interoperability across Facebook's platforms could add convenience for users -- perhaps too much.

title: FTC considers injunction against Facebook over how its apps interact
text: Facebook is finding itself under more regulatory scrutiny over its proposal to integrate WhatsApp and Instagram.

title: Facebook stock takes a beating on report that the FTC might thwart its grand unification plans
text: Regulators may stand in the way of Facebook’s work to link Instagram, WhatsApp, and Messenger.

title: Indexes Hit New Highs On China Trade News
text: The Dow Jones, S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite scored solid gains Thursday on reports of a phase-one trade deal with China.

title: F.T.C. Said to Consider Injunction Against Facebook
text: The agency has discussed taking action to prevent Facebook from knitting together WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger and Instagram.

title: Facebook Stock Drops As FTC Reportedly Weighs Injunction Regarding Apps
text: Facebook stock dropped following a report the Federal Trade Commission is considering a preliminary injunction over antitrust concerns related to how its products interact with competitors.

title: FTC reportedly considers blocking Facebook from integrating messaging services
text: The news comes amid antitrust investigations into the social media giant.

title: FTC may try to delay Facebook's plan to integrate its apps, Wall Street Journal reports
text: Facebook's stock took a dive on Thursday following a report that federal regulators may seek to prevent the company from more tightly integrating its social media products.

title: Facebook caught in regulatory vice with possible FTC action, defiance of new California privacy law
text: Facebook stock falls on report of possible FTC injunction.

title: FTC weighs action against Facebook over how its apps interact: report
text: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is considering seeking a preliminary injunction against Facebook Inc  because of concerns that policies about how its apps interact violate antitrust law, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: The Fate of Facebook Stock Will Come Down to Its Risks
text: The numbers say Facebook stock is a buy. The question is if the risks facing FB stock will say otherwise.

title: FTC weighing injunction against Facebook amid antitrust concerns: WSJ
text: The Federal Trade Commission is considering seeking a preliminary injunction against Facebook over antitrust concerns, The Wall Street Journal reported.The injunction would likely seek to block Facebook from enforcing policies around how its apps interact with each other and work with potential rivals, sources told the Journal. CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports.

title: Facebook falls on report FTC weighing injunction over antitrust concerns
text: The injunction would likely seek to block Facebook from enforcing policies around how its apps interact, sources told the Journal.

title: 7 Tech Stocks to Stuff Your Stocking With

title: Facebook Puts Down $130 Million As Initial Investment In Content Oversight
text: Facebook has followed through on its initial vow to put $130 million into bolstering oversight of content that circulates on its massive social networks. The company has been in a harsh spotlight after issues with phony news and malevolent forces able to put its messages across via Facebook. From election interference to harassment to other

title: A New Instagram Feature Takes Aim at TikTok
text: Facebook's answer to the social media upstart, as well as past challengers, is "if you can't beat 'em, copy 'em."

title: Facebook delays naming oversight board members until 2020
text: Facebook will not announce the first members of its independent oversight board this year as it originally expected, the company said on Thursday.

title: Instagram Stories Already Generates 10% of Facebook's Ad Revenue
text: Is there room for ad spending to keep growing on the popular feature?

title: Australia tells Facebook and Google to commit to competition rules, or else
text: Australia said on Thursday technology giants such as Facebook Inc  and Google will have to agree to new rules to ensure they do not abuse their market power and damage competition, or the government will impose new controls on them.

title: Facebook Promises It Has Fixed Glitch That Caused Political Ads To Disappear Days Ahead Of U.K. Election
text: Amid scrutiny over political ad transparency, Facebook’s system for tracking ad buying and targeting faltered just days ahead of the U.K. general election.

title: VR sales on the upswing, thanks to Facebook's Oculus Quest
text: Virtual reality may be starting to grab people's attention.

title: Facebook rejects Attorney General’s plea for ‘backdoor’ access to encrypted messages
text: Facebook has rejected Attorney General William Barr’s plea for the social-media giant to help law-enforcement officials more easily access encrypted messages.

title: Facebook promised transparency on political ads. Its system crashed days before the UK election
text: Tens of thousands of political ads went missing from Facebook's archive this week, according to researchers, just days before voters go to the polls in the most important UK election for decades.

title: 3 Stocks Immune to the U.S.-China Trade War.
text: Investing in these three stocks could you help you ride out the U.S.-China trade war.

title: Facebook no longer among Glassdoor's top 10 workplaces
text: Facebook Inc  dropped to the 23rd spot in Glassdoor's list of "Best Places to Work" in 2020 from the seventh it secured last year, amid heightened regulatory scrutiny of the world's largest social network.
